title: NASA Pursues Lunar Terrain Vehicle Services for Artemis Missions
summary: NASA is seeking industry proposals for a next-generation LTV (Lunar Terrain Vehicle) that will allow astronauts to go farther and conduct more science than ever before as they explore the south polar region of the Moon during Artemis missions.

title: DARPA seeks AI tools to automate tracking of satellite sensor data
summary: BAE Systems won a $7 million contract from the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency to develop AI tools to automate the tracking of data collected by military satellites.

title: Software problem blamed for ispace lunar lander crash
summary: A software glitch kept a lunar lander from properly determining its altitude, leading to a crash on its landing attempt last month, Japanese company ispace announced May 26.

title: L3Harris wins $80 million Air Force contract for satcom experiments
summary: The U.S. Air Force Research Laboratory awarded L3Harris Technologies a contract worth $80.8 million to conduct communications experiments using multiple commercial space internet services.

title: NASA to Provide Briefing, Coverage of Spacewalks for Station Upgrades
summary: Two NASA astronauts aboard the International Space Station will conduct a pair of spacewalks Friday, June 9, and Thursday, June 15, to install two new solar arrays.
